description: [Status: stable] [Name: non-empty-stub-body] [Message: Function body must contain only ...] What it does Checks for non-empty function stub bodies. Why is this bad? Stub files are never executed at runtime; they should be thought of as "data files" for type checkers or IDEs. Function bodies are redundant for this purpose. Example def double(x: int) -> int: return x * 2 Use instead: def double(x: int) -> int: ...
